授業方法: Due to the continued risk of Covid-19 throughout Kansai, this study program will be held ONLINE. On-demand topic-based tasks, grammar, vocabulary focus, writing practice and self-study tasks (listening/viewing) will be assigned weekly. Regular Zoom sessions will be held for discussion, feedback, idea sharing and exchange.

第1回: Course introduction: orientation and explanation of goals, course format, grading and focus points

From March 31, 2021, Students need to access the online course website and send a Google form to the course instructor, Simon Rowe. Course website URL can be found below at シラバス付加情報 Simon's email: mister.sism@gmail.com
第2回: Topic 1: Why read? Reasons, reading habits, genres and personal favourites
第3回: Topic 2: Short fiction - definition and concepts, examples and famous short story writers
第4回: Topic 3: Plot devices and story structure - understanding story patterns; popular plots
第5回: Topic 4: Character development - personalities, traits and motivations
第6回: Topic 5: A sense of place - how writer's create realistic locations in their stories
第7回: Topic 6: Famous short fiction writers around the world: classic and modern
第8回: Topic 7: Themes and messages I - concepts and definitions; popular themes and messages
第9回: Topic 8: Themes and messages II - how writers connect with their readers
第10回: Topic 9: Tapping readers' imaginations - the art of drawing on senses (smell, sight, sound etc.) to create authenticity in a story
第11回: Topic 10: Dialogue - reading aloud; performing excerpts from a story
第13回: Film: Midnight in Paris; writing a review
